	Strong knowledge of Nigerian HSE laws and regulations.

	HSE certifications such as NEBOSH, IOSH, or HSE Level 3 certification.
	Experience working in the real estate, construction, or property development sectors.


Salary

Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Officer Job at Zibac Consulting




        
    

        
        Zibac Consulting - Our client, a luxury Real Estate company in Abuja, is recruiting dedicated candidates who will play a pivotal role in ensuring the health, safety, and environmental compliance of all real estate operations, from construction sites to client-facing property locations in the capacity below:

Job Position: Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Officer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Reporting To: General Manager

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The ideal candidate will proactively implement HSE strategies and practices that align with our brand’s mission to redefine luxury living, ensuring all employees, contractors, and clients operate in a secure and risk-free environment.
	This role supports organizational excellence by promoting a strong safety culture and adhering to regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, implement, and continuously improve HSE policies, procedures, and site-specific safety plans.
	Conduct regular risk assessments, site inspections, and audits to identify hazards and enforce preventive measures.
	Liaise with regulatory bodies, contractors, and vendors on all safety-related matters.
	Maintain documentation of safety inspections, training records, incident reports, and regulatory submissions.
	Ensure compliance with national health, safety, and environmental regulations and company standards.
	Train employees and contractors on HSE procedures, including emergency protocols and safe work practices.
	Investigate and report incidents, near misses, and non-conformities, and recommend corrective actions.
	Support the General Manager and project teams with HSE planning and reporting for ongoing developments.
	Promote a culture of safety, responsibility, and environmental stewardship across all departments.
	Advise management on improvements in safety systems and risk controls.


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Science, Engineering, Occupational Health & Safety, or a related discipline.
	3 - 6 years of experience in a similar HSE role.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian HSE laws and regulations.
	Experience with site audits, risk assessments, and emergency preparedness.
	HSE certifications such as NEBOSH, IOSH, or HSE Level 3 certification.
	Experience working in the real estate, construction, or property development sectors.


Salary
N260,000 - N350,000 / Month.

Sales & Marketing Manager Job at Marriott International




        
    

        
        Marriott International is a leading global Lodging company based in Bethesda, Maryland, USA, with more than 4,100 properties in 79 countries and reported revenues of nearly $14 billion in fiscal year 2014. Its heritage can be traced to a root beer stand opened in Washington, D.C., in 1927 by J. Willard and Alice S. Marriott.

Marriott has more than 361,000 people working worldwide at managed or franchised properties and corporate offices. Marriott has been consistently recognized as a top employer and for its superior business ethics. The company also manages the award-winning guest loyalty program, Marriott Rewards® and The Ritz-Carlton Rewards® program, which together surpass 49M members.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales & Marketing Manager
Job Location: Ikot Ekpene, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The position is accountable for proactively soliciting and handling sales opportunities.
	Ensures business is turned over properly and in a timely fashion for proper service delivery.
	Assists in leading all day-to-day activities related to sales with a focus on building long-term, value-based customer relationships that enable achievement of sales objectives.
	Achieves personal sales goals.


Responsiblities
Core Work Activities:
Building Successful Relationships that Generate Sales Opportunities:


	Works collaboratively with off-property sales channels to ensure sales efforts are coordinated, complementary and not duplicative.
	Builds and strengthens relationships with existing and new customers to enable future bookings. Activities include sales calls, entertainment, FAM trips, trade shows, etc.
	Develops relationships within community to strengthen and expand customer base for sales opportunities.
	Manages and develops relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
	Provides accurate, complete and effective turnover to Event Management.


Managing Sales Activities:


	Participates in sales calls with members of sales team to acquire new business and/or close on business.
	Executes and supports the operational aspects of business booked (e.g., generating proposal, writing contract, customer correspondence).


Using Knowledge of Market Trends and Target Customer Information to Maximize Revenue:


	Identifies new business to achieve personal and location revenue goals.
	Understands the overall market - competitors’ strengths and weaknesses, economic trends, supply and demand etc. and knows how to sell against them.
	Closes the best opportunities for the location based on market conditions and location needs.
	Gains understanding of the location’s primary target customer and service expectations; serves the customer by understanding their business, business issues and concerns, to offer better business solution.


Providing Exceptional Customer Service:


	Supports the company’s service and relationship strategy, driving customer loyalty by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience.
	Services our customers in order to grow share of the account.
	Executes and supports the company’s customer service standards.
	Provides excellent customer service consistent with the daily service basics of the company.
	Sets a positive example for guest relations.
	Interacts with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels.


Candidate Profile
Education And Experience:


	2-year degree from an accredited university in Business Administration, Marketing, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 3 years experience in the sales and marketing or related professional area.


OR


	4-year bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 1 year experience in the sales and marketing or related professional area.
	Must have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a managerial role, with prior experience in the hotel industry.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Procurement",
  "description": "Sahara Group is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate with operations in over 38 countries across Africa, Middle East, Europe and Asia. Spanning three decades, we have broken ground and challenged stereotypes across the global business landscape. The women and men who make up our organization are our strongest levers for growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Head, Procurement

Job Identification: 381
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Accountabilities
Strategic Procurement &amp; Category Management:


	Develop, implement, and continuously optimize category strategies across direct and indirect spend categories (including fleet, CAPEX, services, IT, energy, and operations).
	Integrate AI and analytics for spend forecasting, risk profiling, and supplier segmentation.
	Apply Total Cost of Ownership (TCO), value engineering, and cost control frameworks to procurement planning.
	Incorporate ESG criteria and circular economy principles into category strategies and sourcing decisions.


Supplier Relationship &amp; Global Sourcing:


	Drive supplier development programs to build robust local capacity and ensure alignment with international standards.
	Manage international procurement transactions including cross-border logistics, Incoterms, trade finance, and import documentation.
	Evaluate suppliers not just on cost, but on ESG scorecards, ethics compliance, sustainability credentials, and innovation partnerships.
	Apply digital tools for supplier onboarding, due diligence (including tax and legal compliance), and risk-based performance evaluations.


Contract, Risk &amp; Compliance Management:


	Negotiate, draft, and manage commercial agreements with embedded risk mitigation clauses (e.g., force majeure, IP rights, ESG compliance, tax clauses).
	Ensure tax-efficient contracting in line with Nigeria&rsquo;s VAT, WHT, Customs Duty and Transfer Pricing requirements.
	Enforce procurement ethics and anti-bribery protocols in line with Sahara&rsquo;s governance and international standards (e.g. UNGC, ISO 20400).
	Leverage contract lifecycle management (CLM) software to monitor obligations, variations, and renewals.


Sustainable Procurement &amp; ESG:


	Embed environmental and social sustainability goals into the supplier evaluation and selection process.
	Develop and report on sustainability-linked procurement KPIs (e.g., CO? reduction per unit purchased, green procurement ratio).
	Align procurement operations with SDGs and Sahara&rsquo;s ESG strategy by fostering supplier circularity, waste reduction, and energy-efficient procurement choices.


Process Digitization &amp; Procurement Transformation:


	Champion the automation of PR-PO-3Way Match workflows via ERP and e-Procurement platforms (e.g., SAP Ariba, Oracle, Coupa).
	Develop predictive dashboards using Power BI, Python/R, or Tableau to inform procurement decisions and highlight cost saving opportunities.
	Drive process maturity to align with ISO 9001, ISO 20400 (sustainable procurement), and CIPS Procurement Excellence models.


Cost Control, Value Engineering &amp; Spend Analytics:


	Develop internal cost benchmarks and procurement indices for frequently purchased materials/services.
	Collaborate with engineering and operations to apply value analysis and VE to procurement of capital items and projects.
	Manage procurement budgets with zero-based costing techniques and scenario-based forecasting.


Team Leadership &amp; Capability Building:


	Lead and mentor a high-performing procurement team equipped with future-ready skills in AI, ESG, analytics, and category expertise.
	Implement professional development plans using CIPS and international certifications to elevate internal capacity.
	Encourage cross-functional learning with legal, finance, tax, sustainability, engineering and operations functions.


Internal Stakeholder &amp; Cross-Functional Collaboration:


	Partner with Legal, Finance, Sustainability, and Business Units to align procurement plans with enterprise objectives.
	Provide strategic procurement advice and early involvement during project planning, budgeting, and contracting stages.
	Support tax teams with data for transfer pricing, customs documentation, and intercompany procurement flows.


Minimum Qualification &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in supply chain management, Business, Engineering, Economics, or related fields.
	At least 7&ndash;10 years of progressive experience in procurement or supply chain management in a multinational or diversified conglomerate.
	MCIPS, CIPS Advanced Diploma or equivalent international certification (e.g., ISM, APICS, PMP, CSCP).
	Solid track record in international sourcing, logistics (air, sea, road), ESG implementation, and ERP-driven procurement operations.


Required Knowledge and Skill:


	Deep understanding of sourcing strategy, supplier markets, and digital procurement tools.
	Practical application of VE, TCO, and cost-modelling for direct and indirect procurement.
	Working knowledge of Nigerian and global tax rules (WHT, VAT, Customs, TP, etc.)
	Strong business judgement with ability to balance cost, quality, risk, and innovation
	Expertise in drafting and interpreting commercial contracts and risk assessments
	Proficiency in Power BI, AI-powered sourcing platforms, and spend analytics tools
	Familiarity with ESG frameworks (SDGs, UNGC, ISO 20400, GRI) and supply chain compliance.
	Proficient in ERP (SAP, Oracle, Dynamics) and eProcurement tools for automation
	Ability to manage cross-functional teams and international supplier relationships
	Strong grounding in procurement ethics, anti-bribery frameworks, and code of conduct.


Personality &amp; Leadership Traits:


	Commercially astute and digitally fluent
	Highly organised, agile, and resilient under pressure
	Strategic thinker with ethical mindset
	Proactive leader and collaborative communicator
	Inquisitive, forward-looking, and innovation-oriented


Key Stakeholder Relationship:


	Engineering, Operations &amp; Projects Teams
	Sustainability &amp; ESG Office
	Finance, Legal, Tax and Audit Units
	Group Strategy, Risk &amp; Internal Control
	International Suppliers &amp; Regulatory Bodies.

Marketer Job at Casalavoro Limited




        
    

        
        Casalavoro Limited is a fast-growing, multi-sector company with thriving interests in Real Estate, Hospitality, and Commodities. With a strong commitment to excellence and innovation, we provide top-tier services that redefine industry standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We're seeking a creative and results-driven Marketer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and executing marketing strategies to promote our hospitality services, drive bookings, and increase brand awareness.
	The goal is to meet or exceed booking targets while building a strong brand reputation.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities to drive revenue growth.
	Build and maintain relationships with clients to increase bookings and revenue.
	Stay up-to-date on CasaLavoro's luxury fixtures, amenities, services, and promotions to effectively communicate with potential guests.
	Develop and execute sales strategies to promote special packages, events, and loyalty programs.
	Provide exceptional customer service to ensure client satisfaction and loyalty.
	Meet or exceed monthly and reservation targets.
	Develop and execute strategies to optimize room bookings and revenue.
	Work closely with team members to identify and pursue new business opportunities.
	Support group sales and event planning efforts through targeted sales initiatives.
	Prepare weekly sales reports.


Requirements


	BSc Degree / HND in Marketing or related field.
	Minimum of verifiable 2-3 years of experience in hospitality sales.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.


Benefits


	Salary: N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.
	Flexible work schedule or remote work options.
	Performance bonuses and content incentives.
	Opportunity to grow with a creative and collaborative team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@casalavoro.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
